column2: Before Richmond, it was the Tigers of Manjimup in awe of Marlion Pickett's 'natural instinct'
column3: Long before his AFL grand final heroics, Marlion Pickett began his junior footy career with the Tigers of Manjimup, not Richmond, and his old home town watches proudly as he makes history.

column2: Tigers fans let of flare on Swan Street
column3: Richmond supporters light a flare during AFL grand final celebrations on Swan Street.

column2: Richmond fans on Swan Street celebrate the grand final win
column3: Richmond fans on Swan Street celebrate as the Tigers clinch an emphatic grand final victory

column2: Tigerland erupts as Richmond fans celebrate grand final win
column3: Thousands of Tigers fans take to the streets of Richmond to celebrate their team's thumping AFL grand final victory over the Greater Western Sydney Giants at the MCG, turning Swan Street yellow and black.

column2: Highlights from the 2019 AFL grand final
column3: Watch highlights from Richmond's big win over the GWS Giants in the 2019 AFL grand final.

column2: Terrific Tigers take the flag as Giants' grand final dreams crushed at the MCG
column3: It's a great day for the Yellow and Black, as Richmond wins a second premiership in three years, crushing the Giants in an overwhelming win at the MCG.

column2: The numbers say this AFL grand final might be closer than you think

column2: Thousands turn out for AFL grand final parade.
column3: Thousands of footy fans turned out to show their support for their teams ahead of the AFL grand final.

column2: Thousands of footy fans line Melbourne's streets for AFL grand final parade
column3: Waves of yellow and black, with smaller splashes of orange, flood into Melbourne beneath grey skies as AFL fans line city streets to catch a glimpse of their heroes ahead of Saturday's clash between Richmond and GWS at the MCG.

column2: From premiership hero to without a footy home. How the AFL shocked a genuine star
column3: A prodigiously talented, goal-scoring genius of the Long-Rioli family is just one of the dozens of men and women left confused and shocked by the AFL's decision to close the Northern Territory's only top-level side.

column2: Richmond can't count on parochial Victorian support to overcome old club rivalries
column3: The suggestion that Victorian supporters would band together behind Richmond ignores the very essence of inter-club sporting rivalry, writes Richard Hinds.

column2: Richmond parachutes in VFL star player to make debut at AFL grand final

column2: 'Welcome to Nat Fyfe country': Tiny towns vie for the title of 'Brownlow capital'
column3: Fyfe's tiny home town of 500 people has produced more than its fair share of AFL and AFLW stars, with nine local players making it to the top in recent years.

column2: How dark days and constant thrashings galvanised the Giants ahead of their first AFL grand final
column3: First they had to win over Sydney's "westies", now they're one win away from conquering the AFL. GWS has gone from competition easy beats to 2019 grand finalists — from little things, Giants grow.

column2: Football club kicked off sportsgrounds over 'inappropriate behaviour'
column3: A two-month independent investigation launched by the City of Marion into The Cove Football Club reveals complaints that some female netball players that share the same council-owned sportsground in Hallett Cove felt they were being sexually harassed.

column2: Giants star Stephen Coniglio ruled out of AFL grand final
column3: Greater Western Sydney's hopes of winning its first AFL premiership are dealt a massive blow, with Stephen Coniglio ruling himself out of the season decider against Richmond.

column2: Balloon football gives people with disabilities a chance at competitive sport
column3: It may not be the AFL but the passion and commitment to the Balloon Football is just as intense for nearly 250 players across Victoria.

column2: Competition is fierce among these balloon footballers vying for grand final bragging rights
column3: For players of the Balloon Football League, or BFL, the passion and competitiveness is just as intense as AFL — the only difference being the players are disabled.

column2: He'll miss the AFL grand final on Saturday, but this GWS Giants star is keeping busy off the field
column3: He is a critical cog in the GWS Giants midfield machine, one of the league's best and highest-paid players. But there are other things that drive Stephen Coniglio.

column2: Make no mistake, we are watching greatness again in Nat Fyfe — and he could get even better
column3: A second Brownlow Medal leaves Nat Fyfe in rare air among some of the AFL's all-time greats. But guiding the Fremantle Dockers back to the finals and to their first premiership would cement his legacy, writes Clint Thomas.

column2: Two weeks after 'urine substitution' suspension, another failed drug test revealed for Willie Rioli
column3: The AFL advises that West Coast Eagles player Willie Rioli tested positive in an in-competition drug test for "a metabolite of cannabis", having previously tampered with a sample in a separate test.

column2: Nat Fyfe wins his second Brownlow Medal
column3: The Fremantle captain is one of two players in AFL history to have more career Brownlow votes than games played.

column2: 'I'm so jealous': Brownlow winner Nat Fyfe hungry for team success

column2: Nat Fyfe king of the AFL again after winning second Brownlow

column2: This couple live in a GWS Giants shrine — but there's one thing missing

column2: GWS was written off by everyone — now it's heading to a grand final

column2: Can a Giants win make a big, big sound in Sydney's west?

column2: GWS's Cameron wrote a note to a stranger after finding their lost wallet, and left a little something inside
column3: Greater Western Sydney star Jeremy Cameron receives praise on social media after a photo emerges of a note he wrote after finding a stranger's wallet.

column2: Giants through to first AFL Grand Final after thrilling win
column3: The GWS Giants have survived a late comeback from the Collingwood Magpies to punch their ticket to their first Grand Final in the club's history.

column2: GWS boss hails team culture after big AFL upset over Collingwood

column2: Giants reach first grand final in epic preliminary against Collingwood

column2: Richmond kick away in final term to book Grand Final spot

column2: Tigers through to AFL grand final after beating Cats

column2: Ex-Collingwood coach Mick Malthouse slams 'name-centric' AFL tribunal

column2: Modern coaches dump the terrifying spray for a new approach and reap the rewards

column2: AFL conspiracy theories mask combative edge to Collingwood and GWS preliminary final

column2: From the footy field to the farm
column3: Ahead of the huge preliminary clash between the Geelong Cats and Richmond Tigers tonight, one player has a unique way to unwind — All-Australian defender Dylan Grimes takes to his tractor and tends to his grapes.

column2: How a female professor from the US helped this tough AFL team embrace their vulnerability
column3: A new willingness to open up about personal struggles and finding a rural sanctuary is empowering Richmond defender Dylan Grimes and his teammates.

column2: Toby Greene's appeal fails, ruled out of Giants' AFL preliminary final

column2: Wayne Schwass encourages people to put mental health first at Danny Frawley funeral

column2: 'I'm proud of how hard you fought': Friends, fans and family gather to farewell Danny Frawley
column3: Family, friends and the AFL community bids farewell to legendary player, coach and media personality Danny Frawley at a "celebration of life" service in Melbourne.

column2: Grass wasn't an option when this footy oval was built in 1895, so they improvised
column3: The Queenstown Crows have a home-ground advantage not many would envy. Rather than a field of lush, green grass, their oval is made of gravel.

column2: Adelaide Crows captain Rory Sloane welcomes baby boy a year after stillbirth tragedy
column3: Rory Sloane and his wife Bel announce the safe arrival of their baby boy, Sonny, just over a year after their first child was stillborn.

column2: Tom Boyd speaks about his mental health on Fox Footy
column3: AFL premiership player Tom Boyd tells Mike Sheahan his mental health struggles were not the reason he walked away from professional football.

column2: Poor performances by AFL teams blamed for price rises at Adelaide Oval
column3: Sports fans in Adelaide are set to be slugged more for food and drink at football and cricket matches, with Adelaide Oval management saying costs have increase because of poor seasons by the Crows and Power.

column2: Toby Greene cops AFL ban, ruled out of Giants' preliminary final

column2: Gillon McLachlan says now is the right time for the AFLW to move to 14 teams

column2: Tom Hawkins to miss Cats' preliminary final because of AFL ban
column3: Geelong will be without key forward Tom Hawkins for Friday night's blockbuster AFL preliminary final against Richmond after he is banned for one match by the tribunal.

column2: Past deeds catching up with Toby Greene as AFL decides Giants star's fate

column2: Danny Frawley's wife releases statement to be 'open with the public' about star's death

column2: Giants ground the Lions at the Gabba

column2: Cats star Hawkins cops one-match ban for striking

column2: Willie Rioli scandal forces Eagles to rethink drug-testing procedures

column2: Pyke's gone, so what's next for the Adelaide Crows?

column2: 'I'm so, so sorry': Willie Rioli breaks silence over drug breach, apologising to fans for 'lil mistake'
column3: West Coast Eagles forward Willie Rioli posts an apology to fans on Facebook a day after a breach of the AFL drug code was revealed that ended his 2019 season.

column2: Jason Dunstall reflects on death of close friend Danny Frawley
column3: The Hawthorn legend said the death of his friend and fellow TV personality had left him with a "giant void".

column2: Garry Lyon reveals 'heartbreak' over Danny Frawley's death in radio tribute
column3: Garry Lyon pays an emotional tribute to former AFL star Danny Frawley as he returns to his radio show, speaking of the "utterly, impossibly heartbreaking" reality of his friend and former colleague's death.

column2: 'He's a bit of a mess': Craig Vozzo on Willie Rioli's suspension
column3: West Coast Eagles football manager fronts the media to explain forward Willie Rioli's suspension for breaching the anti-doping code.

column2: West Coast has a bad history with drugs, but the club has never known a situation like this

column2: Mental illness isn't a fight, it's a marathon without a finish line

column2: Don Pyke steps down as Adelaide Crows coach.

column2: 'I have given my all': Adelaide Crows coach Don Pyke steps down

column2: Tayla Harris's kick immortalised in bronze statue unveiled in Melbourne

column2: 'Forever in our hearts': Danny Frawley's family shocked and devastated by death

column3: Magarey Medallist Luke Partington from Glenelg thanks volunteers for their tireless contribution to football, while SA football greats Peter Motley and Greg Anderson are inducted into the Hall of Fame.

column2: Tributes flow for Danny Frawley
column3: The former St Kilda captain was killed when his car left the road and crashed into a tree in western Victoria yesterday afternoon.

column2: AFL great Jonathan Brown chokes back tears remembering Danny Frawley
column3: As the AFL world mourns the loss of former St Kilda player and Richmond coach Danny Frawley, his peers, friends and colleagues in football and media pay emotional tributes to the man they called "Spud".

column2: Tasmania Now: VFL team needed for AFL dream
column3: DAILY BRIEFING: For a Tasmanian team to win its place in the AFL it first needs a spot in the second-tier league, according to the code's top local official.

column2: St Kilda CEO says the club is left "heartbroken" by Danny Frawley death
column3: St Kilda chief executive Matt Finnis says the club has been left heartbroken by the death of former captain Danny Frawley.

column2: AFL personality Danny Frawley dies aged 56
column3: Former St Kilda star and Richmond coach Danny Frawley has died in a car crash west of Melbourne. He was 56.

column2: Toby Greene free to play in Giants' AFL semi-final despite guilty decision
column3: Greater Western Sydney star Toby Greene avoids suspension and is cleared to play in the Giants' semi-final against the Lions, after being handed a significant fine by the AFL for a serious misconduct charge.

column2: AFL legend Danny Frawley dies in single-car crash in western Victoria
column3: Former St Kilda star and Richmond coach Danny Frawley dies in a car crash in western Victoria aged 56. The player, coach and commentator is remembered as a "legend" of the Saints.

column2: Toby Greene was referred directly to the AFL tribunal for the incident
column3: The 25-year-old GWS Giants player was referred directly to the AFL tribunal for serious misconduct.

column2: 'Dangerous and stupid': Toby Greene accused of 'serious misconduct' as AFL fast-tracks case
column3: Greater Western Sydney star Toby Greene will learn tonight if he will continue to feature in his team's finals campaign, after the AFL brought forward a tribunal hearing to deal with his serious misconduct charge.

column2: Cats, Scott to feel the blowtorch after loss to Pies

column2: West Coast face a major adversary before they even get to the AFL grand final
column3: Hypoxic stress and circadian disruption are just part of the travel toll West Coast's players will face in a finals campaign that will see them travel across the country five times before grand final day, writes Tom Wildie.

column2: Tigers a sight to behold as they hammer Lions at the Gabba
column3: Richmond looms as the team to beat this September after dismantling Brisbane on its own patch, sealing a home prelim and sending the Lions into a semi-final against GWS, who earlier knocked out the Bulldogs.

column2: WA at the 'cutting edge' in trying to separate junk food from sports
column3: Surfing WA's Mark Lane is leading a growing charge of West Australian sporting organisations fighting off unhealthy sponsorships deals in sports.

column2: Magpies down Geelong to reach prelim final
column3: Collingwood stun the minor premiers Geelong and get a week off with a 10-point win in their qualifying final in front of a huge crowd at the MCG. For Geelong, the question after this game is: where to now?

column2: He led the Bombers back from the brink, but the Worsfold-to-Fremantle chatter will not stop
column3: Essendon's return to the AFL finals this year has not stopped mounting speculation about coach John Worsfold's future, and now all eyes are on whether the West Coast Eagles legend ends up at the Dockers, writes Clint Thomas.

column2: Nic Naitanui takes umbrage to having his hair pulled
column3: The Eagles star threw Essendon's Zach Merrett into the boundary line fence after Merrett apparently grabbed Naitanui's dreadlocks.

column2: Eddie Betts lightning goal steals the show
column3: A video of Adelaide Crows star Eddie Betts kicking an impossible goal has stunned social media users.

column2: Does loyalty still have a place in the AFL?
column3: Fans want underperforming players, coaches and officials to be sacked and a younger, fresher generation brought in to rebuild the Adelaide Crows, but they react angrily when moves are made, writes Neil Cross.

column2: Eagles march on, Nic Nat fires up after hair-pulling incident
column3: West Coast's premiership defence is still alive after the Eagles' big win over Essendon, as big man Nic Naitanui made an impressive return from injury.

column2: Young footy fans avoid conviction over 'inexcusable and unacceptable' brawl
column3: Despite pleading guilty, two brothers involved in a brawl at MCG earlier this year avoid conviction after the magistrate accepted they had made "some effort" to stop the fight before it escalated.

column2: Taylor Walker quits as Crows co-captain as club prepares for change
column3: The Adelaide co-captain cites a desire to spend time with family as a major reason for his decision, and his coach insists he will continue to play a key on-field role.

column2: This is what happened when I screened the Adam Goodes documentary in the US

column2: Nathan Buckley has chance to shed Collingwood's King of Pain crown
column3: Nathan Buckley has only known defeat as a head coach and player at Collingwood when it comes to AFL grand finals, but there is reason to believe 2019 will prove to be a different story, writes Richard Hinds.

column2: Collingwood documentary shows some of the toughest moments in footy players' careers
column3: From Adam Treloar's struggles with his mental health, to the delisting of a nine-year veteran, to the sombre scenes in the locker room after losing the AFL grand final — the new documentary looking at the Magpies' 2018 season gives unprecedented behind-the-scenes access to the goings on at an elite football club.

column2: As the cut-throat pressure of finals football begins, Eagles may be forced to pull a selection surprise
column3: In the do-or-die environment that awaits them, the Eagles could be tempted to return to the proven combinations of last year's premiership campaign — and that could see veterans play an integral role in September, writes Tom Wildie.

column2: The burning questions ahead of week one of the AFL finals
column3: What to do with Nic Naitanui? Have the Cats already taken their eye off the ball? And is the Gabba the Lions' secret weapon? Mark Maclure, Ryan O'Keefe, Brent Harvey and Lauren Arnell discuss with Grandstand.

column2: Sydney Stack congratulates Eddie Betts' stunning goal
column3: The pair high-fived, hugged and swapped banter after the terrific snap-kick in the final quarter.

column2: Should he stay or should he go? Rumour mill in overdrive over Adelaide's Eddie Betts
column3: The rumour mill has gone into overdrive on whether Eddie Betts is leaving the Adelaide Crows. ABC sports editor James Coventry explores why Betts should leave, while Crows fan and ABC reporter Sara Garcia looks at all the reasons he should stay.

column2: If the Dockers want to be an AFL 'powerhouse' they should look down the road (and not at the Eagles)
column3: Fremantle's president Dale Alcock has an ambitious plan for the Dockers to become an AFL juggernaut, and while it may be achievable, the club will need to change more than its coach and CEO, writes Clint Thomas.

column2: Eddie Betts says there has been interest but 'no offer' from rival AFL clubs
column3: The Adelaide Crows fan favourite says other clubs have shown interest in him, but he has not been offered a contract from a rival team, as the club continues to search for answers after missing the finals for a second year in a row.

column2: After losing their stillborn son, AFL star Rory Sloane and wife Belinda open up on their pain
column3: A year since losing their baby son, Rory and Belinda Sloane launch a new nationwide stillbirth research campaign with an emotional and heartfelt online video describing their ongoing pain.

column2: Collingwood's Sam Murray 'more committed than ever' to AFL career once ban for doping ends
column3: Collingwood player Sam Murray is issued with an 18-month ban for doping by an AFL tribunal, but will be free to join next year's competition when that ban ends in February.

column2: Magpies justified to enter AFL finals with premiership in their sights

column2: Fan tension boils over as SA's two football clubs crash out of finals contention

column2: A footy superstar who was 'just dad at home': AFL greats farewell 'Polly' Farmer
