column2: The Eagles are hunting back-to-back premierships, and they have three big advantages over last year
column3: No non-Victorian side has come from outside the AFL's top four under the current finals format to take out the flag, and West Coast must win four straight games to do so — but the outlook is not as bad as it looks, writes Tom Wildie.

column2: Does the home-ground 'advantage' really matter in finals footy?
column3: The disadvantage non-Victorian teams have supposedly experienced in MCG grand finals is like citing the disadvantage a young George Clooney had finding a dinner date, Richard Hinds says.

column2: Lions denied minor premiership in Tigers loss, Bulldogs claim finals berth
column3: The Lions miss out on the AFL minor premiership to the Cats following their loss to the third-placed Tigers, the Bulldogs earn a return to finals action, while the Power defeat the Dockers to end their season on a winning note.

column2: Hawks upset Eagles to stay in AFL finals race, Cats secure top-two finish
column3: Hawthorn keeps its finals hopes alive by beating premiers West Coast, Geelong remains a chance of claiming the minor premiership, while the Giants, Swans and Kangaroos enjoy victories.

column2: Pies not hot, but Buckley's men do enough for a shot at the top four
column3: Collingwood gives itself a shot at the double chance, but the Pies' narrow win over Essendon raises more questions than it answers, writes Andrew McGarry.

column2: Collingwood edge Essendon in MCG arm wrestle
column3: Collingwood moves up to third place, temporarily at least, on the AFL ladder after an intense 11-point win over Essendon at a packed MCG.

column2: Buddy confirms he will play to age 36 on eve of 300th game
column3: After a frustrating year of injuries, superstar Sydney Swans forward Lance Franklin gears up for his 300th game on Saturday, predicting he will fulfil the final three years of his monster $10 million contract with the club.

column2: The Hawks and the Giants played AFL in the snow, but was it the first time ever?
column3: When snow fell during an AFL match between the Hawks and the Giants, it was lauded as the first time it had ever happened during an AFL game. Fact Check dove into the archives to see if that was correct.

column2: Amid a dismal record and a fan revolt, the Dockers have been forced to take drastic action
column3: Ross Lyon was a brilliant coach, the best in Fremantle's history. But after four dismal seasons and with membership numbers sliding, the Dockers board finally had enough, writes Clint Thomas.

column2: Fremantle sack coach Ross Lyon as club boss admits Dockers 'haven't performed'
column3: After an underwhelming season, the Fremantle Dockers sack their coach of eight years Ross Lyon and chief executive Steve Rosich will also depart in an attempt to revive the club's flagging fortunes.

column2: The 'Gabbatoir' is back in business as Brisbane Lions prep for big finals run
column3: It's been a while since Brisbane's glory days at the Gabba, but on a big weekend of AFL footy a win over the Cats show the young Lions are roaring again, writes Alister Nicholson.

column2: One man continues to burn bright in the gloom engulfing the Dockers
column3: Fremantle have missed the AFL finals for the fourth straight year, but from the darkness of a disappointing season Nat Fyfe continues to shine, writes Tom Wildie.

column2: Generation gap irrelevant on weekend of AFL that had something for everyone
column3: If the AFL finals can match the quality and intensity of the penultimate round of the season it should be enough to keep all the fans happy, writes Richard Hinds.

column2: Tigers pip Eagles in game of the season, Roughead celebrated in style
column3: Richmond edges West Coast by a goal in a game for the ages, while the Bulldogs closed in on finals by thumping the Giants and Jarryd Roughead kicked six on his special night.

column2: Lions on top after thriller against Geelong, SA clubs endure night from hell
column3: The Brisbane Lions sit on top of the AFL ladder after a thrilling one-point win over Geelong, while Port Adelaide and Adelaide's seasons are in disarray after they were smashed by North Melbourne and Collingwood respectively.

column2: Swans ease to victory over Demons at the MCG
column3: The Sydney Swans end a run of six straight losses with a comfortable win over the Demons at the MCG.

column2: Former AFL star Nicky Winmar avoids jail over drunken assault on cab driver
column3: Winmar is sentenced to a community corrections order, including 100 hours of community service, after pleading guilty to recklessly causing injury to a Melbourne taxi driver after an AFL game in March.

column2: This footy club has 130 girls, but their changerooms only have one toilet and one urinal
column3: Women's football has taken off across Australia, but there's one big issue — a lack of facilities. At one Hobart club girls are forced to use the public toilets and get changed outside because of a lack of facilities.

column2: Australians want to mimic NBA superstars like Ben Simmons — but they don't understand them
column3: You can't laud American sport for creating larger-than-life characters and outspoken players, and then condemn stars like Ben Simmons for lacking homegrown humility, writes Offsiders' Richard Hinds.

column2: Remembering Graham 'Polly' Farmer
column3: The legendary AFL ruckman has passed away at age 84 after a long struggle with Alzheimer's disease.

column2: The power of 'Polly' rocked football and the racist Australia of the 50s and 60s
column3: Graham "Polly" Famer, who has died at the age of 84, revolutionised Australian rules football and stood as an Indigenous champion both on and off the field, writes David Mark.

column2: Four hours of footy set to define the 2019 AFL season
column3: In the tightest season in memory, the AFL fixture has given footy fans a pre-finals gift, offering up two games this weekend that will ultimately be crucial in the destination of the premiership flag.

column2: Remembering 'Polly' Farmer
column3: The legendary AFL ruckman has passed away at age 84 after a long struggle with Alzheimer's disease.

column2: The top stories on ABC News
column3: Woman killed in Sydney CBD yesterday identified as Michaela Dunn, Hong Kong Airport Authority receives order to restrict protests blocking operations, Russia cancels evacuation of area near experimental rocket explosion despite massive spike in radiation levels, and AFL legend Graham 'Polly' Farmer in Perth dies aged 84.

column2: The top stories on ABC News
column3: Woman killed in Sydney CBD yesterday identified as Michaela Dunn, Hong Kong Airport Authority receives order to restrict protests blocking operations, Russia cancels evacuation of area near experimental rocket explosion despite massive spike in radiation levels, and AFL legend Graham 'Polly' Farmer in Perth dies aged 84.

column2: Graham 'Polly' Farmer dies at 84
column3: Raised in an orphanage and suffering polio as a child, Graham "Polly" Farmer overcame early adversity to become one of Australia's best AFL players during the 1960s.

column2: AFL legend and Indigenous trailblazer Graham 'Polly' Farmer dies at 84
column3: Raised in an orphanage and suffering polio as a child, Graham "Polly" Farmer overcame adversity to become one of Australia's best AFL players in the 1960s, playing 356 games and winning three Sandover medals.

column2: Fremantle Dockers giant Aaron Sandilands — once the AFL's tallest player — retires from football
column3: Fremantle ruckman Aaron Sandilands announces his retirement, with the Dockers set to give him a farewell home game against Essendon this Saturday night.

column2: Hero Hawk Roughead to get an emotional AFL farewell match
column3: Four-time Hawthorn premiership hero Jarryd Roughead will play this Sunday against Gold Coast, giving Hawks fans the chance to say goodbye to the retiring club legend.

column2: Essendon, GWS are the wrong kind of surprise packets in an unpredictable AFL season
column3: The performances of the Bombers and Giants were the razorblades in the toffee apple that was a strange weekend of AFL footy, writes Alister Nicholson.

column2: After another heartbreaking loss, Dockers members are hitting Freo where it hurts
column3: Four losses by less than seven points and likely a fourth AFL finals series missed in a row — it is a frustrating time to be a Fremantle fan, writes Tom Wildie.

column2: Eagles and Tigers hold on to set up huge clash, Saints win thriller
column3: Hard fought wins to West Coast over Adelaide and Richmond over Carlton set up a tantalising top-four showdown between the Eagles and Tigers next Sunday, while the Saints have plenty to celebrate after a late win over Fremantle.

column2: Cats, Lions strengthen top two claim, Bulldogs humiliate Bombers
column3: Massive wins for Geelong and Brisbane over North Melbourne and Gold Coast respectively have them closing in on a top two finish, while the Bombers are completely dismantled by the Bulldogs.

column2: Hawthorn whitewashes flaky GWS as snow falls on AFL match in historic first
column3: Hawthorn keeps its finals hopes alive by smashing GWS in Canberra on a night when the weather took centre stage, with snow falling at Manuka Oval during the first half.

column2: Former AFL star Nicky Winmar to plead guilty to assaulting taxi driver
column3: The lawyer for former AFL star Nicky Winmar indicates the 53-year-old will plead guilty to assaulting a Melbourne taxi driver following an AFL match at Docklands in March.

column2: Expanded AFLW will get clear air next season as much-maligned AFLX gets the boot
column3: After just two instalments and no end of scepticism from AFL clubs and fans, the maligned AFLX exhibition is canned for 2020, allowing for more column inches for the expanded AFL Women's competition.

column2: Junior sport has no place for ugly coaching behaviour
column3: The good "old-fashioned spray" from coaches may have been commonplace in sports such as Australian rules a long time ago, but their presence at the junior levels needs to be stamped out, writes Richard Hinds.

column2: The emotion on the field showed this was no ordinary win for the Dockers
column3: There were hugs and high fives in the beleaguered Fremantle camp after their stunning win on the weekend, as West Coast were left stuck in a logjam for top spot on the ladder with three games to go, writes Tom Wildie.

column2: Lions beat the Bulldogs after Pies, Eagles get the points
column3: The Lions get a narrow win over the Western Bulldogs to stay in striking distance of top spot, after Collingwood takes care of the Suns at the MCG and West Coast beats Carlton on the road.

column2: Crows, Tigers, Giants take care of business as Power, Freo cause upsets
column3: Adelaide and Richmond earn comfortable wins, but the big upset comes earlier as Fremantle stuns Geelong in the west, after Port Adelaide smashes the Bombers and the Giants edge the Swans.

column2: Kangaroos start slow but finish fast to beat Hawks
column3: The Kangaroos celebrate Rhyce Shaw's confirmation as coach with a gutsy 22-point victory over the Hawks, as they stay in the race for a berth in the finals.

column2: Journalist Stan Grant says the controversy prompted a wider conversation about racism in Australia
column3: The documentary examines what happened when Indigenous football star Adam Goodes started to call out racism in 2013.

column2: 'You're just a big sook': Adam Goodes speaks out on the booing saga that made him hate the footy field
column3: Adam Goodes says the booing saga that overshadowed the final years of his AFL career turned the football field into a place he hated.

column2: Reclink Cup salvaged for now, but future funding under a cloud
column3: A charity football event pitting colourful media personalities and musicians against each other is salvaged at "the last stroke of midnight", due to a new funding model.

column2: 'I am to blame': Port Adelaide CEO pens letter as pressure mounts on coaches
column3: As Port Adelaide's CEO takes the unusual step of telling fans to blame him — not coach Ken Hinkley — for his club's poor form, the Crows are also in damage control as pressure mounts on coach Don Pyke.

column2: The race is on to lure Tim Kelly back to WA, but have West Coast priced themselves out of the contest?
column3: Tim Kelly left Perth two years ago a virtual unknown, but arrives back this week an AFL star after a breakout start to his career — and the Dockers and the Eagles are jostling to snare the Brownlow Medal contender.

column2: GRAPHIC CONTENT WARNING: Video of violent 2018 assault near the MCG
column3: Victoria Police released footage of the assault on two men that took place after a 2018 AFL finals round game between Richmond and Hawthorn at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG) in the hope of identifying the offenders.

column2: Bashing accused front court as victims of alleged attack deny starting fight
column3: Three men front court accused of an attack near the MCG, as the two victims of the alleged bashing deny starting a fight that resulted in them repeatedly being kicked and punched as they lay on the ground.

column2: It's a rerun of the same 'bad movie' — a Dockers season fade out as the Eagles soar to the finals
column3: The contrasting fortunes of Perth's AFL sides are clear to see — Fremantle is all but assured of missing the eight for a fourth straight year, while West Coast's attention is firmly on a top four spot, writes Tom Wildie.

column2: Cats back to winning ways, Bombers snatch win from Suns
column3: The Cats rebound to beat the Swans in Sydney, while the Bombers edge out the Suns in a pulsating finish on the Gold Coast and the Bulldogs trump the Dockers.

column2: Giants pip Power after Saints beat Demons
column3: The Giants beat the Power by one point, after the Saints beat the Demons. Earlier, the Eagles, Lions and Blues enjoyed victories in round 19 of the AFL.

column2: Tigers score convincing win over Magpies at the 'G
column3: Richmond steamrolls Collingwood by 32 points in an ominous blowout at the MCG, cementing its status as premiership favourites and leaving the Magpies in a world of trouble ahead of the finals.

column2: Should the AFL draft age be lifted to give players real world experience?
column3: Amid the seemingly endless ways a player can find their way onto an AFL list, Port Adelaide co-captain Tom Jonas says increasing the minimum draft age would be a good way to ensure better choices were made by the clubs and players.

column2: Fans draw battlelines over Ross Lyon's future at Fremantle
column3: As speculation rages around Ross Lyon's future, Fremantle fans have divided into two polarised camps — they are either firmly behind him or want him gone, writes Ben Cameron.

column2: What do you do when your footy team's beaten by 509 points?
column3: A scoreline of 79.41 (515) to 1.0 (6) has reversed a country AFL team's own, regular weekly triple-figure defeats. But is this just another tally of country footy's troubles?

column2: Fremantle coach Ross Lyon fails to dampen speculation he is planning to jump ship
column3: Speculation around the future of Fremantle coach Ross Lyon is likely to grow after he refuses to confirm or deny if other clubs have spoken to him about the possibility of jumping ship from the Dockers.

column2: Can the Adelaide Crows return to glory by salvaging their 'kick-a-Vic' roots?
column3: With local footballers an increasing minority in the Adelaide Crows' on-field squad, perhaps it is time to question what wearing state colours means.

column2: Gillon McLachlan reflects on his handling of the Adam Goodes booing saga
column3: In an interview with ABC Radio Melbourne, AFL chief executive Gillon McLachlan says he wishes he had called out the booing of Adam Goodes more quickly and clearly.

column2: 'A decision for Adam': AFL boss fears Goodes may be lost to the game
column3: In his first detailed interview on the Adam Goodes documentary since its airing, Gillon McLachlan speaks about the league's failures in its handling of the racism controversies that marred the final years of the dual Brownlow winner's playing career.

column2: Christensen, Lions condemn racist comments as disgraceful
column3: The issue of racism in Australian rules football has hit the headlines again, as Indigenous Brisbane Lions player Allen Christensen calls out a supporter who wrote racist comments about him online.

column2: Brisbane Lions' premiership chances are looking good as the top teams hit a slump
column3: The AFL's most compelling contender in the past few weeks is the contestant no-one thought would survive the early elimination rounds, let alone reach the series finale, writes Richard Hinds.

column2: Hawks stun the Cats at the MCG, Saints and Eagles get a win
column3: The Saints have given interim coach Brett Ratten a winning start by beating the Western Bulldogs at Docklands after  the Hawks upset the Cats at the MCG and West Coast beat Melbourne in Alice Springs.

column2: Adam Goodes 'cut down' by racist booing because he was powerful, says commentator Charlie King
column3: Sports broadcaster Charlie King calls out Andrew Bolt, Eddie McGuire, and Sam Newman, and lays down a challenge to AFL to prove it has changed, in the wake of a documentary chronicling racism that led to the end of the Australian footballer Adam Goodes's celebrated career.

column2: Woman and man charged with assault after latest AFL spectator altercation
column3: A woman and a man are charged with assault and banned from Adelaide Oval for three months following another violent altercation in the crowd at an AFL game.

column2: Lions, Dockers have the edge in thrilling finishes
column3: The Lions' resurgence continues as they edge out North and Freo pip the Swans after the Tigers beat the Power, the Giants thump the Pies and the Blues get the better of the Suns.

column2: Bombers beat Crows to move a step closer to AFL finals
column3: Written off earlier in the AFL season, the Bombers are now eyeing off a finals berth after consolidating their position inside the top eight with an impressive 21-point win over the Crows at Adelaide Oval.

column2: NT footballing legend Jack Long farewelled in Darwin
column3: Hundreds of people are expected to gather in Darwin today to pay their respects to one of Australia's most famous sporting patriarchs, who lost his battle with dementia and prostate cancer last week.

column2: 'We're rapt': Richmond coach confirms Jack Higgins will play in 2020 after brain bleed
column3: A birth abnormality is revealed as the cause of the brain bleed that will sideline Richmond's Jack Higgins for the rest of the season.

column2: Richmond confirms brain bleed for young Tigers star Jack Higgins
column3: Last year's winner of the AFL goal of the year, Jack Higgins, is in hospital with a brain bleed after the Tigers' star complained of a headache following a VFL game on the weekend.

column2: There are three AFL head coaching gigs up for grabs, but is it still the safest top job in world sport?
column3: The job security of an AFL coach is often considered tenuous, particularly when their team is underperforming. But the introduction of a soft cap in 2015 — to limit the level of off-field disadvantage for smaller clubs — has potentially saved some of the league's underperforming coaches.

column2: St Kilda in search for 'new voice' as coach Alan Richardson steps down
column3: The 54-year-old coach is leaving the Saints after five-and-a-half mostly unsuccessful years at the helm of the AFL club, having won just 43 of his 126 games in charge.

column2: Lions beat Power to move to third, Tigers and Bulldogs both victorious
column3: The Lions ignore the niggle to record an eight-goal win over the Power and move up to third on the AFL ladder, while the Tigers and Bulldogs enjoy their respective victories.

column2: Cats contain Saints as Crows embarrass Suns
column3: The Saints fall to the ladder-leading Cats in Geelong, the Crows humiliate the Suns by almost 100 points, the Bombers pipped the Kangaroos, while the Hawks and Blues also posted wins.

column2: Collingwood pulls off gutsy one-point win over familiar foe West Coast
column3: Collingwood's season is suddenly back on track thanks to a spirited and gutsy one-point win over West Coast in Perth, with the Magpies overturning a three-goal deficit to pip their grand final nemesis.

column2: Mark ‘Bomber’ Thompson fined for drug possession, but trafficking charge dropped
column3: AFL coach and premiership player Mark "Bomber" Thompson is fined $3,000 for drug possession but has a drug trafficking charge against him dismissed.

column2: 'I just really didn't care': How football is getting Indigenous boys back in the classroom
column3: The prospect of playing football with mates was the only thing that could coax 13-year old Dasha Hill back to school a few months ago.

column2: Just a knock to the head? This is what concussion does to your brain
column3: A knock or jolt to the head can set off a wave of changes in your brain that may need proper management for long-term recovery. Here's what we know about concussion.

column2: Scapegoats abound with Origin and Cricket World Cups on the line
column3: The gap between Escape Goat and #GOAT can be wafer thin in the modern sporting world of high expectations but even lower attention spans, writes Richard Hinds.

column2: Majak Daw returns to the playing field
column3: Majak Daw runs on to the ground for the Kangaroos' VFL side for the first time since he was seriously injured last December.

column2: Majak Daw returns to the playing field, with two metal rods in his hips
column3: Star Kangaroos defender Majak Daw returns to the playing field a little more than six months after he was hospitalised after an incident near Melbourne's Bolte Bridge last December.

column2: Lions roar into AFL top four, Roos and Demons enjoy wins
column3: The Lions beat the Giants to move a step closer to securing a finals berth, while the Kangaroos topple the Saints in Hobart and the Demons celebrate winning a nail-biter against the Blues at the MCG.

column2: NRL decade in review: The team and player of the decade
column3: Droughts were broken and we saw some of the game's greatest players call time on their careers. But who was the best, the most dominant and the most exciting of the 2010s?

column2: Rugby league player avoids jail for on-field attack after court finds victim provoked him with a punch and 'black dog' slur
column3: A Fijian rugby league player who broke an opponent's jaw will not go to jail after a court accepts "reprehensible" acts of provocation had occurred before the assault.

column2: NRL star Josh Reynolds charged over alleged domestic violence incident
column3: West Tigers player Josh Reynolds hands himself into police in Sydney, who charge him over an alleged domestic violence incident in which a woman sustained bruising to her arm and leg.

column2: 'To suppress the demons': Ex-NRL player Jarrod Mullen pleads guilty to cocaine charge
column3: The former Newcastle Knights and NSW State of Origin player tells how he spiralled out of control, taking cocaine daily, after his NRL career ended.

column2: Valentine Holmes returns to NRL after being cut by NFL's Jets
column3: The North Queensland Cowboys confirm the signing of the former Queensland Origin star who was released by the American NFL's New York Jets on the weekend.

column2: The boxing draw that 'felt like a loss': Gallen and Hall can't be separated in battle of the footy codes
column3: The 'Code War' bout between former rugby league star Paul Gallen and ex-AFL champion Barry Hall sees both brawlers forced to share the spoils after the fight ends in a draw.

column2: David Fifita has 'learnt a big lesson' as he returns to Brisbane after time in Bali jail
column3: David Fifita is back in Brisbane three days after being arrested for alleged assault in Bali, and Broncos chief executive Paul White says the 19-year-old's side of the story will soon be told.

column2: Brisbane Broncos star David Fifita released from Bali jail
column3: Star Brisbane Broncos forward David Fifita walks free from his jail cell in Bali, days after allegedly punching a security guard outside a nightclub.

column2: NRL star David Fifita locked up in Bali after alleged nightclub brawl
column3: David Fifita, one of the hottest commodities in the NRL, has been locked up in Bali after an alleged nightclub brawl and has been described by local police as too "under the influence" to be interviewed.

column2: Sonny Bill Williams has reportedly signed a $10m deal with Toronto Wolfpack. So who or what are they?
column3: Sonny Bill Williams reportedly signs a $10m deal with the Toronto Wolfpack. Here's what you need to know about rugby league's "wild and wacky" upstarts.

column2: Tonga scores major upset win over Kangaroos in rugby league Test
column3: The Kangaroos are edged 16-12 by Tonga in their rugby league Test, sparking emphatic celebrations at Eden Park.

column2: NRL star Sam Burgess charged over alleged domestic dispute
column3: Newly retired NRL star Sam Burgess will appear in court in December over an alleged incident at a residence near Bowral earlier this month.

column2: Sam Burgess forced into early retirement
column3: South Sydney Rabbitohs forward Sam Burgess has been forced into early retirement from the NRL aged 30 due to a chronic shoulder injury.

column2: NRL star charged over stabbing at Sydney church
column3: Manly Sea Eagles hooker Manese Fainu will spend the night behind bars after he was refused bail during a court appearance in which he was accused of stabbing a man outside a church in Sydney's south-west last week.

column2: Young Kangaroos impress in victory over New Zealand
column3: Australia's next generation of rugby league stars land their first blow against New Zealand, bouncing the Kiwis 26-4 in Wollongong.

column2: Jillaroos post convincing victory over Kiwi Ferns to keep winning streak alive
column3: Australia's Jillaroos maintain their three-year dominance of New Zealand's Kiwi Ferns with a 28-8 triumph in their Test match in Wollongong.

column2: Test star's ban over Bali brawl labelled 'dehumanising' by former NRL stars
column3: The NRL is accused of treating players like "products" rather than people over its decision to ban New Zealand prop Nelson Asofa-Solomona for three Tests despite acknowledging he was provoked.

column2: NRL under fire from Indigenous body over grand final Welcome to Country
column3: The Gold Coast Titans regain sponsor TFH Services, who issued an apology to club captain Ryan James for comments over his Welcome to Country stumble at the grand final, but now the NRL is the target of criticism over the incident.

column2: Nelson Asofa-Solomona banned for Tests over Bali brawl, but free to start 2020 NRL season
column3: The Melbourne Storm's Nelson Asofa-Solomona will be available to play in the opening round of the NRL next season, despite being handed a three-match suspension after a violent altercation while on holiday in Bali.

column2: 'Tears in my eyes': The footy premiership that cost $150,000
column3: The Mornington Island Raiders love their footy, but the remote community team are paying exorbitant costs in flights, fuel and accommodation just to attend their matches.

column2: Social media video appears to show Melbourne Storm player in Bali brawl
column3: Video published on the @thenrlroast Twitter account appeared to show a Melbourne Storm player involved in a violent altercation outside a Bali nightclub.

column2: Rugby league authorities investigate after Melbourne Storm player involved in Bali brawl
column3: The NRL's integrity unit launches an investigation after a video posted on social media appears to show Melbourne Storm's Nelson Asofa-Solomona swinging punches during a brawl outside a nightclub.

column2: Australia to ease kava import limits in Pacific diplomacy push
column3: Prime Minister Scott Morrison announces during a visit to Suva Australia will ease import restrictions on kava as part of efforts to improve relations with Fiji and other Pacific countries.

column2: A league of their own: 30,000 footy players and fans flock to 'modern-day corroboree'
column3: As a place to glimpse the next generation of stars and one of the biggest events on the Indigenous calendar, the Koori Knockout features some of the fastest, most exciting rugby league in the country.

column2: Roosters fans celebrate grand final victory — just don't mention the referees
column3: Sydney Roosters fans chant "back to back" as they focus on the positives of their team's controversial second NRL grand final victory in two years.

column2: Peter Beattie backs officials on 'six again' controversy
column3: Peter Beattie is the latest NRL figure to back the controversial reversal of the "six again" call in the NRL grand final, but he promises an end-of-year review will consider the incident.

column2: 'Six again': Two words this NRL grand final will forever be remembered for
column3: You can talk about the 2019 NRL grand final until you feel like you've rubbed your larynx with sandpaper but there are only two words you will ever need to say — 'six again'.

column2: NRL stands by controversial six-again and sin-bin calls in grand final
column3: Two decisions by referees in the second half of the Roosters' NRL grand final win attracted plenty of scrutiny, but the NRL is backing its officials for the calls they made.

column2: NRL Grand Final: Call of six-again reversed
column3: A call of six-again is reversed with eight minutes left on the clock during the 2019 NRL Grand Final between the Sydney Roosters and Canberra Raiders.

column2: Sydney Roosters are the victors of the 2019 NRL Grand Final
column3: The Sydney Roosters are the 2019 NRL premiers after a 14-8 victory over the Canberra raiders at AAMI Park

column2: Roosters sneak past Raiders to win successive premierships in controversial fashion
column3: Some dubious refereeing decisions steal some of the spotlight from the Roosters' remarkable feat of becoming the first team since 1993 to win back-to-back premierships in a unified competition.

column2: Last-gasp NRL grand final try sees Roosters go back to back, as it happened
column3: The Sydney Roosters are the first team to win consecutive NRL premierships since 1993, beating the Canberra Raiders 14-8 in a gripping grand final. Look back at how the action unfolded in our live blog.

column2: 'It signals we're ready for war': The origin of Canberra's Viking horn
column3: The Green Machine has reached the NRL grand final for the first time in 25 years. Along the way, it raided a few ideas from overseas.

column2: Sydney Roosters expected 'to do something special' in NRL grand final against Raiders
column3: The Sydney Roosters may be on the verge of a dynasty should they get past the Canberra Raiders in tomorrow's NRL grand final and win their second-straight premiership, according to some of the club's greats.

column2: How Josh Hodgson became the greatest stripper in the NRL
column3: The NRL has been revolutionised by an Englishman, his Canberra Raiders teammates and their secret code — and it could hold the key to the NRL grand final.

column2: Raiders need to ignore pre-match noise to have any hope in grand final
column3: Viking claps, giant horns and nostalgic tales of the great 'Green Machine' must be ignored by the underdog Canberra Raiders if they are to have any chance of beating the heavily favoured Roosters in Sunday's NRL grand final, writes Richard Hinds.

column2: NRL player James Segeyaro tests positive to the same drug that saw Shayna Jack suspended
column3: Brisbane Broncos player James Segeyaro is provisionally suspended by ASADA after returning a positive test for LGD-4033, also known as Ligandrol, to which Australian swimming star Shayna Jack also tested positive.

column2: James Tedesco beats Cameron Smith to win Dally M Medal
column3: The Roosters fullback has the best individual season score in more than a decade with a tally of 34 points, the highest of any player since Johnathan Thurston's 36 in 2007.

column2: NRLW - Broncos v Dragons
column3: Women's rugby league is just one sport where concussions have become an unfortunate part of the game.

column2: There's just one thing missing from Cooper Cronk's CV
column3: Cooper Cronk has achieved everything in the game, but as he prepares to play his final NRL match in Sunday's grand final against the Canberra Raiders, he has one more accolade in his sights.

column2: Poor, average or great coach? The NRL grand final could deliver the verdict on Ricky Stuart's career
column3: Raiders mentor Ricky Stuart has 196 wins, 196 losses and 2 draws in his 394-game coaching career. So is he a poor, average, good or even a great coach? Sunday's NRL grand final against the Roosters could be the decisive factor in moulding "Sticky's" legacy, writes Richard Hinds.

column2: Roosters march to NRL decider after bruising SCG encounter
column3: The Sydney Roosters will defend their NRL premiership against the Canberra Raiders after seeing off a game Storm side in a bruising contest at the SCG.

column2: Josh Papalii free to play NRL grand final as Raiders chase 'their own history'
column3: Canberra star Josh Papalii avoids suspension to be cleared for the NRL season decider, as the Raiders look to win their first premiership since their glory days 25 years ago.

column2: Raiders outlast the Rabbitohs in frenetic NRL preliminary final
column3: The Raiders withstood a tremendous South Sydney Rabbitohs onslaught to reach its first grand final since 1994 with a 16-10 victory at a sold-out Canberra Stadium.

column2: Folau return to rugby league blocked as RLIF suspends Tonga
column3: The Rugby League International Federation deals big blow to Israel Folau's hopes of playing for Tonga — but it's not about the ex-Wallaby star, according to Peter Beattie.

column2: Why the Canberra Raiders can end their 25-year grand final drought
column3: Thirty years ago, the Raiders finished fourth on the ladder. And who did they beat to reach the grand final? None other than South Sydney, who they'll meet again tomorrow night in the preliminary final.

column2: Boom Raiders full-back comes from nowhere to become the NRL's ultimate escape artist
column3: Twelve months ago, few would have heard of him. But now Charnze Nicoll-Klokstad's elusiveness is a prime reason the Raiders are in a semi-final on Friday night.

column2: 'All the best to him': Former Wallabies teammates back Israel Folau's bid for rugby league return
column3: Israel Folau receives support from some of his former national teammates, as he looks to be cleared to play for Tonga in its upcoming rugby league Tests.

column2: Best Team Never
column3: 30 years on and it still hurts. The Balmain Tigers lost the 1989 Rugby League Grand Final to the Canberra Raiders in one of the greatest deciders ever played. In this interview special Andrew Moore speaks with three key protagonists; Benny Elias, Paul Sironen and Steve ‘Blocker’ Roach about the best team never to win a premiership. We re-live all the incredible moments in this enthralling re-cap.

column2: Israel Folau plans shock rugby league return with Tonga, but approval yet to be granted
column3: Israel Folau is banned by Rugby Australia and the NRL over his controversial social media posts — but he plans to return to international rugby league, playing for Tonga.

column2: 'Controversial doesn't mean wrong': NRL hits back at critics of referees after weekend of sin-binnings
column3: NRL head of football Graham Annesley defends the sin-binning of Manly's Jake Trbojevic against South Sydney, saying the rules do not change when it comes to finals.

column2: Cameron Smith fined for slap on Parramatta's Reed Mahoney
column3: Melbourne Storm skipper Cameron Smith cops a fine after denying he tried to slap Parramatta Hooker Reed Mahoney in the face in Saturday night's NRL semi-final.

column2: Storm bring the electricity as Eels knocked out in semi
column3: Melbourne Storm set up a preliminary final clash with the Sydney Roosters next weekend, taking care of Parramatta with a seven-try thrashing at AAMI Park.

column2: NRL insists Trbojevic's sin bin was correct
column3: It was the call that defined the match, but the NRL says its referees were right to sin bin Jake Trbojevic late in Manly's controversial semi-final loss to the Raiders.

column2: Rabbitohs take down Sea Eagles in dramatic NRL semi-final
column3: The Rabbitohs keep their NRL premiership hopes alive and move through to the preliminary finals after a controversial 34-26 victory over the Sea Eagles at Sydney's Olympic stadium.

column2: Rugby league club ordered to destroy 'rape and pillage' t-shirts
column3: Members of a NSW rugby league club who were photographed at an airport wearing offensive t-shirts emblazoned with a topless mermaid look set to face the wrath of the sport's officials.

column2: 'I'm embarrassed': Broncos deal with humiliating finals defeat
column3: The Brisbane Broncos will undertake a throughout review after their NRL season ended in a whimper, as Darius Boyd cautions social media trolls to curb the negative comments.

column2: Ricky Stuart and the Raiders eyeing a return to the glory days
column3: Ricky Stuart is still tied to the Raiders' golden era, but now he has Canberra within 80 minutes of a first grand final in a quarter-century, writes Richard Hinds.

column2: Eels make history with 58-point flogging of Broncos in elimination final
column3: The Eels blitz the Broncos in a one-sided elimination final, laying on 11 tries without reply to set up a final against the Melbourne Storm in week two.

column2: Manly eliminates the Sharks, Raiders stun the Storm
column3: Cronulla's season is over after a loss to Manly at Brookvale, while the Raiders leave the AAMI Park crowd stunned as they earn a spot in the preliminary final with a win over the Storm.

column2: Roosters thrash Rabbitohs to book NRL preliminary final berth
column3: The Roosters humiliate the Rabbitohs 30-6 in the opening NRL qualifying final at the SCG, keeping their premiership defence on track with a scintillating six-try performance.

column2: The Storm-Lightning partnership shows how a strong culture can lead to sporting success
column3: On face value, a Melbourne NRL club and a Super Netball team on the Sunshine Coast appear unlikely associates. But in a few short years, their partnership has seen both revel in on-field success and form a culture that is the envy of many other Australian sporting clubs.

column2: Hudson Young found guilty of 'eye gouging', will miss eight weeks
column3: The 21-year-old Canberra Raiders player will still be banned from play when a new NRL season kicks off next year, after he was handed an eight-match ban for a dangerous contact charge.

column2: Stuart has 'over-achieved' as Raiders coach, putting the club in strong stead for the next three years
column3: On the eve of their first finals campaign in three seasons, the Canberra Raiders have received a massive boost with coach Ricky Stuart extending his deal with the club for another three years.

column2: Brookvale Oval given green light to host Sea Eagles and Sharks clash after asbestos scare
column3: Saturday's NRL elimination final between the Manly Sea Eagles and Cronulla Sharks will be played at Brookvale Oval, despite asbestos being found at Manly's home ground.

column2: Suburban Sydney NRL clubs fight for survival on and off the field
column3: The Wests Tigers and Cronulla do-or-die encounter before an emotion-charged suburban crowd was, in a sense, the right game at the wrong time for an NRL hierarchy intent on "rationalising" Sydney clubs, writes Richard Hinds.

column2: Manly at risk of losing NRL final because of asbestos concerns
column3: Asbestos found on the family hill at Brookvale Oval puts Manly's home ground at risk of losing the hosting rights to the NRL elimination final against Cronulla.

column2: Sharks clinch NRL finals berth after ruining Farah fairy tale
column3: The Sharks wrap up a spot in the finals with a 25-8 win over the Tigers as Robbie Farah's career comes to a close, while the Panthers end a disappointing season with a 54-10 thrashing of the Knights.

column2: Raiders miss out on third, Bulldogs and Dragons claim wins
column3: The Raiders miss the chance to move up into third place by narrowly losing to the Warriors, while the Bulldogs knock off the Broncos and the Dragons pile even more pain on the Titans.

column2: Storm get the job done, Eels jump Manly into fifth
column3: Minor premiers Melbourne finish on a high as they beat the Cowboys at AAMI Park, after the Eels down Manly to claim fifth.

column2: Queensland firefighters and police honour 9/11 first responders ahead of 18th anniversary
column3: Queensland firefighters and police officers will join their counterparts in the US to mark the anniversary of the attacks on the World Trade Centre on September 11 —  the deadliest day in history for US firefighters.

column2: Rabbitohs upset the Roosters in close encounter
column3: South Sydney runs out of replacements to finish with 12 men, but the Rabbitohs beat the Roosters to give themselves a chance to grab third spot ahead of Canberra.

column2: 'It's not fair': Sharks fans upset by stadium redevelopment
column3: For 50 years, Cronulla Sharks fans have been congregating at Shark Park but for the next two seasons they'll be displaced while it's being redeveloped. Meanwhile rumours are circulating the club is on the list of Sydney teams facing the axe.

column2: Raiders ruin Gallen's farewell, Tigers still in the finals hunt
column3: The Tigers still have finals aspirations after a convincing win over the Dragons, after the Canberra Raiders knocked off the Cronulla Sharks in golden point in Paul Gallen's farewell home match.

column2: Manly threatened with loss of home final after fan arrested for confronting Storm's Will Chambers
column3: The issue of ground security during NRL games at Brookvale is under the microscope after a Manly fan is arrested for confronting Melbourne's Will Chambers.

column2: Storm seal minor premiership, Roosters take care of Panthers
column3: Melbourne Storm claim the minor premiership and bragging rights over Manly Sea Eagles, while the Sydney Roosters tune up with victory over Penrith and the Knights get a feel-good win over the Titans.

column2: Broncos claim dramatic victory over Eels in golden point, Rabbitohs also win
column3: The Brisbane Broncos claim a dramatic golden-point victory over the Eels at Lang Park to keep their finals hopes alive. Earlier, the Rabbitohs beat the Warriors in Auckland.

column2: Cowboys end the Bulldogs' slim finals hopes with narrow victory
column3: The North Queensland Cowboys has ended the Canterbury Bulldogs' finals hopes with a 15-8 victory in the final NRL match at Townsville Stadium.

column2: Captain-coach appeals sentence for on-field assault that broke victim's jaw
column3: A rugby league player is handed a jail term for a "ferocious" on-field assault that left an opponent with major facial injuries, but immediately appeals against the severity of the sentence.

column2: Sea Eagles down Raiders after Storm beat Titans
column3: The Sea Eagles hang tough to defeat the Raiders 18-14 in a thrilling clash in Canberra, as the Storm consolidate top position on the ladder with a 24-8 win over the Titans.

column2: Roosters thrash Dragons after Sharks, Tigers post big NRL wins
column3: The Roosters make light work of the Dragons with a commanding 34-12 triumph, as the Sharks and Tigers enjoy their dominant victories in the race for the NRL finals.

column2: Rabbitohs a man down but into top four in ill-tempered win over Broncos
column3: The South Sydney Rabbitohs hold off Brisbane's late charge in a spiteful clash at Lang Park, while the North Queensland Cowboys comfortably account for Penrith.

column2: Bulldogs stun Eels to make it four straight and move within touching distance of finals
column3: Giant-killers Canterbury deal the Eels' NRL top-four hopes a massive blow with a 12-6 boilover in a spiteful thriller at Parramatta Stadium.

column2: Jack de Belin withdraws legal challenge against NRL
column3: St George Illawarra player Jack de Belin has withdrawn his legal challenge to the NRL's no-fault stand down policy, with his lawyers telling a Federal Court in Sydney there was "no utility" in proceeding.

column2: Knights coach Nathan Brown to leave NRL club
column3: Newcastle Knights coach Nathan Brown to leave the NRL club after four seasons.

column2: Cowboys forward Matt Scott recovering after mild stroke
column3: The North Queensland Cowboys prop Matt Scott — who is due to retire at the end of the season — is in a Brisbane hospital after suffering a mild stroke on Sunday.

column2: NRL player Jack de Belin to face trial shortly before start of 2020 season
column3: Rugby league player Jack de Belin will stand trial on sexual assault charges in March next year, just two weeks before the start of the 2020 NRL season.

column2: Roosters flog Warriors, Sharks in the eight after beating Dragons
column3: Cronulla moves into eighth place on the NRL ladder after a hard-fought win over the Dragons, after the Roosters made light work of the Warriors in an ominous performance ahead of finals.

column2: Raiders upset Storm, Bulldogs dent Souths' top four hopes
column3: South Sydney misses its chance to jump into the top four, losing to the Bulldogs, after the Storm lost to the Raiders and the Knights broke their drought with a big win over North Queensland.

column2: Broncos' top-eight chances get boost with win over Panthers
column3: The Broncos get the job done at Lang Park with a four tries to two win over Penrith, after the Eels crush the Titans at Robina.

column2: Florida forward set to play for NRL feeder team
column3: A North Queensland Cowboys feeder club hopes its American import is more than your average Joe when he trots out for his first QRL game this weekend.

column2: Manly bounces back with win over Wests Tigers at Brookvale
column3: Manly takes care of Wests Tigers at Brookvale Oval to leapfrog the Rabbitohs into fourth spot on the ladder — at least until Saturday night.

column2: The colour of your child's sports uniform could be the reason they're getting injured
column3: Dark-coloured jerseys could lead to poor performance, increased rates of injury, and even jeopardise the careers of young rugby league players, researchers say.

column2: Ros Childs brings you the latest ABC News headlines
column3: Flights resume in Hong Kong as protesters vow to return, charity aircraft operator Angel flight found to have safety record seven times worse than other private charters, ABC Managing Director David Anderson appeals to Parliamentary Committee for more press freedom, and Israel Folau's case against rugby Australia to go to trial in February.

column2: Ros Childs brings you the latest ABC News headlines
column3: Flights resume in Hong Kong as protesters vow to return, charity aircraft operator Angel flight found to have safety record seven times worse than other private charters, ABC Managing Director David Anderson appeals to Parliamentary Committee for more press freedom, and Israel Folau's case against rugby Australia to go to trial in February.

column2: Folau legal counsel speaks outside court
column3: The ex-NRL star's multi-million dollar case against Rugby Australia will go to trial in February next year, if a scheduled mediation between the two parties on December 13 fails.

column2: NRL launches investigation into racist abuse of Latrell Mitchell
column3: The Sydney Roosters gun is the latest high-profile Australian sportsman to become the victim of vile racist abuse online, with the NRL opening an investigation and bans awaiting the perpetrator.

column2: Storm, Roosters still the teams to beat after impressive wins
column3: The Melbourne Storm and Sydney Roosters lay down yet another ominous marker with wins in potential finals previews against the South Sydney Rabbitohs and Canberra Raiders respectively.

column2: Wallabies defeat All Blacks 47-26 in record Bledisloe Cup win
column3: New Zealand played the entire second half a man down after Scott Barrett was sent off in the 40th minute.

column2: Dogs knock off Tigers, Eels pip Knights to close in on top four
column3: The Bulldogs held on to beat the Wests Tigers at the Olympic stadium, after the Dragons broke their losing streak with a win over the Titans and the Eels pipped the Knights.

column2: The Green Machine’s Golden Boy to hit yet another milestone
column3: The sports world outside the ACT's borders is finally starting to catch up with how well the Canberra Raiders are performing — and more attention is coming, with the club's co-captain about to hit a major milestone.

column2: Cleary spearheads Panthers win over Sharks, Warriors hold off Manly
column3: The Panthers are too much for the Sharks in Penrith after the Warriors hold on grimly to claim a 24-16 win over Manly. Follow all the live scores, stats and commentary.

column2: Broncos move into top eight with sloppy last-minute win over Cowboys
column3: The Broncos beat the Cowboys 18-14 thanks to a last-minute Jake Turpin try, but don't let the scoreline fool you, this was not one of those classic Queensland derbies.

column2: Eels eke out a win, Roosters run away with it against Titans
column3: The Eels consolidate sixth spot with a win over the Dragons, after the Roosters thrash the Gold Coast Titans to stay ahead of the Raiders and Rabbitohs.

column2: Sharks down the Rabbitohs to take top eight spot
column3: Cronulla grabs a spot in the eight with a win over Souths, Manly takes care of Newcastle at Brookvale and the Bulldogs beat the Panthers in Saturday's NRL.

column2: Storm dish out thrashing to Broncos as Raiders crush Warriors
column3: The ladder-leading Storm embarrass the Broncos on their home turf with a 40-4 triumph, while the red-hot Raiders consolidate their spot in the top four by dismantling the Warriors 46-12.

column2: Wests Tigers beat Cowboys to move into NRL top eight
column3: As the NRL finals begin to appear on the horizon, the Wests Tigers jump inside the top eight after scoring five tries to one in their convincing 28-4 win over a disappointing North Queensland Cowboys outfit at Leichhardt Oval.

column2: Holbrook confirmed as new Titans coach on two-year deal
column3: The Gold Coast Titans finally confirm Justin Holbrook will coach the struggling NRL side from the 2020 season, with the current St Helens boss signing a two-year contract.

column2: Jason Saab is a glimpse of bright future after another dismal end to the Dragons season
column3: St George Illawarra's season is all but over, but a sensational debut from young winger Jason Saab in the team's latest loss may be a sign of better things to come.

column2: A scandal every 22 days: NRL's 'Summer of Hell' invoked in response to de Belin appeal
column3: The ARLC has suggested that Jack de Belin needs a "reality check" as it argues that the code's no fault stand-down policy is necessary because the sport has been "beset by a series of scandals."

column2: 'Now the time is right': Wests Tigers great Robbie Farah announces retirement
column3: Robbie Farah, the Wests Tigers stalwart who represented New South Wales, Australia and Lebanon, will hang up the boots at season's end after 17 years in the NRL.

column2: Raiders, Roosters consolidate spots in NRL top four
column3: The Raiders beat the Panthers 30-18, while the Roosters claim a 20-12 victory over the Bulldogs as round 19 of the NRL comes to a conclusion.

column2: Mark Coyne resigns from NRL commission after drunken night in Singapore
column3: Retired Queensland State of Origin representative Mark Coyne resigns from the Australian Rugby League Commission (ARLC) following an incident in Singapore, leaving NRL chair Peter Beattie "devastated".

column2: Sea Eagles sink Storm in golden-point classic
column3: A Daly Cherry-Evans field goal late in extra time gives the Sea Eagles a pulsating 11-10 win over the Storm, after the Broncos beat the Titans 34-12 and the Eels get home 24-22 against the Warriors.

column2: Rabbitohs take down Dragons after Tigers edge out Knights
column3: The second-placed Rabbitohs just get home against the Dragons 20-16 after the Tigers hold on in a thriller against the Knights, winning 28-26.

column2: Sharks sneak home against Cowboys to break losing streak
column3: Cronulla snaps a five-match losing streak with a 16-14 win over an injury-hit North Queensland to remain in the hunt for the NRL finals.

column2: Jarryd Hayne says rape allegations have taken a toll on his family
column3: The former rugby league star pleads not guilty to two counts of aggravated sexual assault against a 26-year-old woman in the NSW Hunter Valley and tells reporters outside court it's been "a very hard time" for his family.

column2: NRL player Jack de Belin could face maximum sentence of life in prison after new charge laid
column3: The rugby league player is slapped with an extra charge which carries a maximum sentence of life in prison as he is committed to stand trial in August over the alleged aggravated sexual assault of a 19-year-old woman in Wollongong.

column2: 'I was ready to walk away': Farah rebounds to make 300th NRL appearance
column3: Robbie Farah thought his NRL career was on the scrapheap as he contemplated retirement not so long ago, but now the Wests Tigers great finds himself preparing for his 300th first grade match.

column2: Peter Beattie says Mark Coyne deserves 'natural justice'
column3: Australian Rugby League Commission chairman Peter Beattie will meet with stood-down commissioner Mark Coyne days before he fronts a hearing to decide his fate.

column2: Manly gets the better of the Eels, Storm crush the Titans
column3: Manly sends fans home happy with a win over the Eels at Brookvale after the high-flying Storm down the Titans at Robina.

column2: Souths grab the points against the Cowboys
column3: South Sydney leaves it late to beat the Cowboys in Townsville, after the Roosters crush the Knights at the SCG and the Raiders get up against Wests Tigers.

column2: Panthers thump Dragons after Warriors edge out Sharks
column3: The Panthers thrash the Dragons 40-18 to stretch their winning streak to seven matches, while the Warriors enjoy a 19-18 victory over the Sharks in Wellington as the race for the NRL finals heats up.

column2: Broncos outclass Bulldogs as Belinda Sharpe makes NRL history
column3: The Broncos keep their slim finals hopes alive with a 28-6 win over Bulldogs in Brisbane, as Belinda Sharpe creates history as the first woman to referee an NRL match.

column2: Mark Coyne stood down by Australian Rugby League Commission
column3: The Australian Rugby League Commission announces Mark Coyne has stood down from the organisation after being charged for using "indecent, threatening or abusive words" in Singapore.

column2: NRL's first female referee hopes to become an inspiration
column3: Belinda Sharpe becomes the first woman in Australian rugby league's 111-year history to referee a professional men's top-grade match and she wants to inspire young girls to follow her trailblazing path.

column2: Gold Coast Titans coach sacked
column3: The Gold Coast Titans announce they are parting ways with coach Garth Brennan, citing the team's poor performance on field this season, as Kevin Walters rules himself out as a replacement.

column2: Raiders destroy Dragons after Eels, Cowboys post wins
column3: The Raiders outclass the Dragons in Wollongong, as the Eels beat the Tigers to spoil Benji Marshall's 300th NRL match, and the Cowboys enjoy a narrow triumph over the Roosters.

column2: Cameron Smith celebrates 400-match NRL milestone as Storm beat Sharks
column3: The Storm make Cameron Smith's 400th NRL match a night to remember with a 40-16 thrashing of the Sharks, while the Broncos and Warriors play out a rare draw, and the Rabbitohs scrape home against Manly.

column2: Bulldogs off the bottom with win over Knights, Panthers ease past Titans
column3: The Bulldogs have gone above the Titans at the bottom of the NRL table, after the former upset the Knights in Newcastle and the latter was comfortably beaten by Penrith.

column2: Pearce finds redemption as Tedesco etches his name into Origin folklore
column3: James Tedesco's incredible try handed the Blues an Origin miracle of their own, as Mitchell Pearce finally got his hands on the prize that had painfully eluded him in seven previous attempts.

column2: State of Origin 3: Highlights from the decider
column3: Watch the highlights from another State of Origin thriller at Sydney's Olympic stadium as NSW tries to post their first back-to-back series wins since 2005.

column2: Tedesco scores at the death to seal State of Origin decider thriller for NSW
column3: New South Wales fullback James Tedesco scores a try in the final 20 seconds to deliver the Blues their first back-to-back State of Origin series victory since 2005.

column2: 'Crash, bang and tackle at 100 miles an hour': A level field for Wheelchair State of Origin players
column3: Men and women of all abilities face off in Wheelchair Rugby League, a fast and furious sport that has just as much impact off the field as on it.

column2: Just a knock to the head? This is what concussion does to your brain
column3: A knock or jolt to the head can set off a wave of changes in your brain that may need proper management for long-term recovery. Here's what we know about concussion.

column2: Scapegoats abound with Origin and Cricket World Cups on the line
column3: The gap between Escape Goat and #GOAT can be wafer thin in the modern sporting world of high expectations but even lower attention spans, writes Richard Hinds.

column2: Baby Broncos shock Sharks with 24-22 NRL win
column3: A youthful Broncos line-up, missing several players because of State of Origin duty, posts a gutsy 24-22 victory away to the Sharks to halt a three-match losing streak.

column2: 'It's a pretty simple job': Paul Vautin shows interest in coaching Maroons again
column3: He famously coached the Maroons to a State of Origin series victory in the 1990s, and now Paul Vautin is considering putting his hand up again if Kevin Walters makes way in the role.

column2: Warriors steal dramatic 24-20 NRL win over Knights
column3: The Warriors score a late try to clinch a 24-20 victory over a Knights outfit depleted by State of Origin duty and injury in Newcastle.

column2: Keary guides Roosters to NRL win over Tigers
column3: Sydney Roosters five-eighth Luke Keary sets up three tries in his comeback match to lead the Sydney Roosters to a 24-16 victory over Wests Tigers.

column2: Storm edge out Dragons 16-14 to extend lead on top of ladder
column3: The Storm hold on in a tight encounter against the Dragons to win 16-14 in Wollongong, as both sides struggle to cover for their missing State of Origin stars.

column2: Former NRL star Jarryd Hayne to stand trial for aggravated sexual assault
column3: Former rugby league star Jarryd Hayne is committed to stand trial on charges of aggravated sexual assault of a woman in the NSW Hunter region.

column2: Mitchell Pearce gets chance at State of Origin redemption with NSW call-up
column3: He has been the butt of jokes when it comes to State of Origin, but Mitchell Pearce has a chance of finally winning a series with New South Wales after Nathan Cleary is ruled out of game three because of injury.

column2: George Burgess rubbed out for nine NRL games over eye gouge
column3: George Burgess is handed the biggest suspension in the NRL in seven years after his eye gouge on Robbie Farah, meaning he will only return for South Sydney if the Rabbitohs make the finals.

column2: Robbie Farah among 17 Lebanon players banned after 'detestable act'
column3: The Lebanese Rugby League Federation bans 17 squad members in the wake of players threatening to tape over the Cedars' logo ahead of the mid-season Test against Fiji.

column2: Cleary and Sims both named for NSW but Maroons without Ponga for Origin III
column3: Brad Fittler has kept faith with the victorious Blues side from game two, but star Maroons fullback Kalyn Ponga is out of the Queensland side for Origin III.

column2: Bulldogs, Panthers grab narrow wins to end round 15
column3: The Bulldogs get the points against the Sharks after the Panthers grab a win over the Warriors in golden point at Mount Smart Stadium. Follow all the live scores, stats and commentary.

column2: Parramatta comeback stuns Canberra in the Territory
column3: The Eels come from three tries down to beat the Raiders in the Territory after the Sea Eagles crush the Titans at Robina and the Knights get the points against the Broncos in Newcastle.

column2: Melbourne storms clear in race for minor premiership with Roosters win
column3: The Storm hold off the Roosters at Adelaide Oval to take a six-point lead on the NRL ladder, after the Dragons take down the Cowboys in Wollongong.

column2: Israel Folau to keep 'standing up for freedoms of all Australians'
column3: Israel Folau 'disappointed' unable to reach settlement with Rugby Australia but says he will 'standing up for freedoms of all Australians'

column2: Israel Folau calls for apology from Rugby Australia
column3: The former rugby star will meet with Rugby Australia at the Fair Work Commission in Sydney today.

column2: 'It looked like he was trying to rip his eyeball out': Burgess in trouble after alleged eye gouge
column3: South Sydney's George Burgess has been sent straight to the NRL judiciary after being placed on report for an alleged eye gouge in the Rabbitohs' 14-9 loss to the Wests Tigers.

column2: Researchers say extent of brain injury unknown for contact sports
column3: The lead researcher in a landmark study identifying CTE in rugby league players says the extent of the disease's prevalence is unclear because it's currently only possible to diagnose in an autopsy.

column2: Brain disease found in former NRL players for first time
column3: A leading Sydney researcher discovers a degenerative brain disease associated with repeated brain injuries in autopsies of two former first-grade rugby league players.

column2: 'This is what multiculturalism looks like': Shadow Assistant Treasurer Stephen Jones on Folau debate
column3: Shadow Assistant Treasurer Stephen Jones says he disagrees with Israel Folau but is "deeply uncomfortable" by the way the debate has been handled.

column2: Tom Trobojevic dominated the match with a hat trick
column3: New South Wales levelled the State of Origin with a 38-6 win over Queensland.

column2: New South Wales beats Queensland 38-6 to set up State of Origin decider
column3: New South Wales has beaten Queensland 38-6 in a dominant performance in State of Origin game two in Perth and set up a series decider in Sydney.

column2: NSW claims Women's State of Origin victory over Queensland
column3: A stunning second-half performance sees New South Wales retain bragging rights in Women's State of Origin, as the Blues celebrate a 14-4 win over Queensland at North Sydney Oval.

column2: Israel Folau launches crowd-funding campaign for his legal fees
column3: The former Wallaby and Waratahs player is battling his dismissal by an independent panel over comments he made on social media.

column2: Women's State of Origin clash a far cry from days gone by
column3: Gone are the days of "chook raffles" or paying their own way to games, as the Queensland women's State of Origin team laces up to take the crown from NSW in tonight's second clash at North Sydney.

column2: State of Origin II in Perth set to live up to blockbuster billing
column3: It's Perth's first taste of what is a truly national phenomenon, and State of Origin II promises not to disappoint fans in the west with all its traditional storylines, writes Richard Hinds.

column2: Classic moments from past clashes between NSW and Queensland women's teams
column3: Gone are the days of "chook raffles" or paying their own way to games, as the Queensland's women's State of Origin team laces up to take the crown from NSW.

column2: As the Origin show rolls into town, one crucial thing stands in the way of an NRL team in Perth
column3: The biggest league match of the year rolling into Perth this week will inevitably trigger discussions about whether WA should have its own NRL side, but that decision depends on something far more important than crowd sizes, writes Tom Wildie.

column2: 'Home away from home' hostel keeps Indigenous boys engaged in school
column3: While there is a push to close the gap on education, a NSW hostel for Indigenous boys has a waitlist that could take years to get through.

column2: Maloney back in the halves as NSW make seven changes for Origin II
column3: NSW makes a massive seven changes for the must-win Origin II in Perth on Sunday, led by the return of James Maloney to the halves — while injury forces two changes for Queensland.

column2: Roosters crush the Bulldogs, Manly too strong for Dragons
column3: The Roosters entrench themselves in the top four with a win over the Bulldogs at the SCG after Manly defeats the Dragons at Brookvale.

column2: Eels hand Broncos a lesson, Storm and Panthers get points
column3: The Eels make a mess of the Broncos in Parramatta after the Storm ran roughshod over the Knights and the Panthers won a close one against the Rabbitohs.

column2: Heartbreak for the Cowboys in golden point as Warriors beat Tigers
column3: The Cowboys' big comeback against the Tigers proves all in vain in a golden point loss in Townsville, after a Queensland Origin forward goes down for the Titans in a defeat by the Warriors on Friday night football.

column2: Raiders hold on against Sharks but lose Cotric to injury
column3: The Raiders keep their place in the NRL top four following a gripping finish in their 22-20 victory over Cronulla at a chilly Canberra Stadium, but their win is soured by an injury to Nick Cotric.

column2: Dragons hammer Bulldogs to break NRL losing streak
column3: The Dragons end a five-match losing run by crossing for six tries in their 36-12 thrashing of the Bulldogs in the Queen's Birthday NRL encounter at Sydney's Olympic stadium.

column2: Panthers score upset win over Roosters, Titans tame Broncos
column3: The Panthers cause a boilover against the Roosters to make it three wins in a row, after the Titans spring an upset against the Broncos in their Queensland derby.

column2: Manly pip Cowboys up north as Sharks, Storm claim big wins
column3: Manly secures its top eight spot with a crucial win over North Queensland, after Cronulla and Melbourne enjoyed big wins over Parramatta and the Warriors respectively.

column2: Four binned in Knights' win, Raiders thrash Wests Tigers
column3: The NRL judiciary will have some work to do after four players are sin-binned in Newcastle's win over South Sydney, while the Raiders blank Wests Tigers in Parramatta.

column2: 'They missed the occasion': Sleepless nights ahead for Blues coach Fittler after Origin loss
column3: Blues coach Brad Fittler admits he has "more sleepless nights" ahead as his tactics and key players come under question after Queensland's win in the State of Origin opener at Lang Park.

column2: State of Origin Game I in three and a half minutes
column3: Watch the best bits of State of Origin Game I.

column2: Indigenous NRL players protest the use of the lyric "young and free" in the national anthem
column3: Some players have refused to sing Advance Australia Fair because they say the words "young and free" are disrespectful to 60,000 years of pre-European Indigenous history.

column2: Queensland fights back after toothless first half to win State of Origin opener
column3: A Dane Gagai double leads Queensland to a come-from-behind 18-14 State of Origin victory over New South Wales in Game I at Lang Park.

column2: Collecting State of Origin memorabilia saved this man's life
column3: Jimmy Considine and his wife Kay have a home dedicated to the Queensland State of Origin team — their collection of memorabilia gives the paraplegic man reason to get out of bed each day.

column3: Indigenous State of Origin players will refuse to sing Advance Australia Fair tonight, because they say the words "young and free" are disrespectful to 60,000 years of pre-European Indigenous history.

column2: Cowboys hang on to outlast the Titans in a low-scoring thriller
column3: The North Queensland Cowboys hang on to secure a two-point victory over the Titans, who were unable to convert a number of chances at the death to win the game.

column2: NRL right not to stop State of Origin national anthem boycott

column2: Panthers continue winning form against disappointing Sea Eagles

column2: State of Origin hopeful Adam Reynolds injured in Rabbitohs triumph

column2: Knights smash the Roosters, Titans too strong for Manly

column2: State of Origin captain's quiz goes back in time

column2: Cooper Cronk announces NRL retirement

column2: Cooper Cronk announces NRL retirement
column3: NRL halfback Cooper Cronk announces 2019 will be his last season after 15 storied seasons playing professional rugby league.

column2: Cherry-Evans injured in Manly win, Knights triumph over Eels

column2: Raiders too good for Eels as Dragons thrash Canterbury

column2: Marathoner Jess Trengove is balancing pregnancy with Olympic training

column2: It's time to hang up the spikes: Pearson retires from athletics

column2: Meet the first Aussie woman to run 800m in under two minutes in a decade

column2: Meet 'first and last' runner Ralph Schubert, 89

column2: Raelene Boyle continues fight to be recognised as real winner of 1972 Olympics race
column3: There are fresh calls for Australian athletes who lost to East German competitors suspected of doping to be recognised by the International Olympic Committee.

column2: You've never seen a finish to a hurdles race quite like this one

column2: World Medical Association chair slams athletics testosterone ruling as unethical

column2: 'I will switch races when I want to — no man can tell me what to do'

column2: Three uncomfortable cases that will change sport as we know it

column2: Caster Semenya found to have benefit from her testosterone levels
column3: Caster Semenya has lost an appeal against rules designed to decrease naturally high testosterone levels in some female runners.

column2: Olympic champion Caster Semenya loses testosterone appeal

column2: Runner says push for prize for female runner was never about money

column2: Kipchoge, Kosgei and … Big Ben? Athletes light up London Marathon

column2: She won her race but was told she needed to beat the men to win a prize

column2: Farah accused of assault as feud with Gebrselassie escalates

column2: Sasha Zhoya dominates in 200m sprint

column2: 92-year-old Heather Lee prepares for the Masters Championships

column2: 92-year-old world champion race walker shares the secret to her success
column3: Heather Lee walks the walk. A relative newcomer to race walking, Lee now holds numerous world records and the nonagenarian puts her success down to one simple training tip.

column2: Inglis responds to fat shaming comments
column3: Greg Inglis says he laughs fat-shaming comments off, but it 'does get you down after a while'.

column2: Semenya-IAAF legal showdown has begun, and the ramifications could be huge

column2: False start on sponsorship signals changes for Stawell Gift footrace

column2: No guts, no glory for man shaping up as new golden boy of Australian athletics

column2: Kurt Fearnley's marathon victory named Best Sporting Moment of the Year

column2: 'Older, but not weaker': Comp's oldest competitors claim silver and gold

column2: Declan Tingay a rising star in race walking as hard work pays off

column2: Tour de France and Superbike world champions to compete at Pan Pacs
